did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Minutes of the Board of Commissioners of the Virginia Housing Development Authority,

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Virginia Housing Development Authority (VHDA) is the state's mortgage finance agency. Created in 1972 by the Virginia General Assembly, its mission is to help Virginians with low and moderate income levels attain quality, affordable housing. VHDA is a quasi-government agency, and as such, the governor appoints its eleven-member Board of Commissioners. However, the authority is self-supporting and does not use tax dollars to fund its lending programs.

odd.p: These records are part of Record Group 180 (Virginia Housing Development Authority).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Minutes and meeting materials of the Board of Commissioners of the Virginia Housing Development Authority, [cite specific dates and accessions used], State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession 43807 was transferred by Elliott, Clarence--Virginia Housing Development Authority, 601 S. Belvidere St., Richmond, VA, 06/11/2008

scopecontent.p: Contains Board of Commissioner's meeting minutes and other meeting materials and related attachments. Also includes committee meeting minutes.
